steps.heading: What is the size of your bedframe?
steps.text: Your bed is the most-used piece of furniture in your home and on average, you sleep for one third of your life.

options.heading: Standard
options.text: Your bed is from a UK/Irish retailer or you purchased your bed from IKEA after October 2013 when we started selling UK size beds.

options.heading: EU
options.text: Your bed is from an EU retailer or you purchased your bed from IKEA before October 2013 and it has a slightly longer frame.

steps.heading: How much support do you prefer?
steps.text: Your mattress should provide the right support to support your spine in its neutral position when lying in bed. But itâ€™s also a simple matter of preference.

options.heading: Foam
options.text: A foam mattress supports each part of your body by closely following your movements in bed.

options.heading: Memory Foam
options.text: A layer of memory foam moulds to the contours of your body, relieves pressure and helps you relax.

options.heading: Sprung
options.text: Choose a sprung mattress for an even distribution of weight and elimination of unwanted pressure on any body parts. Plus, ventilated spring construction provides good air circulation so you can enjoy a cool and dry microclimate.

steps.heading: Firmness
steps.text: The feeling of firmness comes from a spring or foam core, combined with the top layer of a mattress. Whether you prefer a firm foam or softer spring mattress is down to individual preference.

options.heading: Medium Firm
options.text: Suitable for all sleeping styles, but especially side-sleepers. Suited to smaller people as they need a little less mattress support for their body weight.

options.heading: Firm
options.text: Perfect if you mainly sleep on your stomach or your back. Better for larger people as a firm mattress provides greater body weight support.
